iati-activity.title: Indigenous women improving family nutrition in the Peruvian Amazon Jungle
iati-activity.description: The project will contribute to improving health and nutrition of the population in Satipo Province. It will train native women to use local products in order to increase food security. It will strengthen the capacities of local partners and other CSOs to undertake studies on nutrition, carry out regular monitoring of nutrition programmes, and advocate for inclusion of local products within those programmes. The action will build the capacities of local governments to produce public expenditure reports related to nutrition programmes and strengthen existing platforms to improve coordination of those programmes. The project will promote cooperation among local producers and build support for development in the UK through a photo exhibition and a media report that will portray the impact of chronic malnutrition and appropriateness of using locally grown products to target malnutrition.
iati-activity.participating-org: Federación Regional de Asháninka, Nomatsiguenga y Kakintes (FREMANK)
iati-activity.recipient-country: The Project takes place in the Peruvian Amazon Jungle regions
